availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Lewis McConnell (Catlettsburg, Boyd County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Catlettsburg, Boyd County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Isabella McConnell. Father of James H. McConnell and Lucy B. McConnell. Attorney in Greenup County, Kentucky in 1850. Attorney in Catlettsburg, Boyd County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned four enslaved individuals in Catlettsburg in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, District 2, p. 162A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, Catlettsburg, p. 801.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, p. 1.
Find A Grave, "Charles Lewis McConnell (Oct 31, 1825-Jun 10, 1906)," Memorial #134439921, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/134439921 (accessed May 22, 2020).
